title: Are there stories which focuses on the death of King Arthur alone and not on the supporting characters? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the Middle Ages the “chronicle tradition” tended to be about the life and death of King Arthur, not his knights. Note—life and death. I can think of no source strictly about his death. My knowledge of modern Arthurian renditions is limited and I cannot speak with any authority about their emphasis, other than noting that the versions that follow the chronicle tradition instead of the romance tradition emphasize the king instead of his men, as the chronicles did.
Most versions tell the full story, but Tennyson wrote “Le Morte D’Arthur” originally as a stand alone poem. He later rewrote it as “The Death of Arthur” and the final section of “Idylls of the King.”
